ovdesc.p: The ASCII VAL TABLE table is used to define which ASCII characters may be used for validation against any 'IN2' routine defined on the ASCII VALUES table. The 'IN2' routines are used to validate the entry to particular fields.
The format of the ASCII VAL TABLE allows any combination of ranges or single values of ASCII codes to be defined.

Care should be taken when modifying the values allowed by the system, particularly when using S.W.I.F.T. type fields, as this may cause unexpected results by allowing non-standard characters to be entered.

This field contains the ID of the ASCII.VAL.TABLE.

The default tables provided all have an ID of 'STANDARD.' followed by the type of IN2 routine, for example the default table for IN2A is called 'STANDARD.A'. However, any user defined tables may have any ID.
The default 'STANDARD.' tables cannot be changed by the user. In order to customise a table the relevant 'STANDARD.' record should be copied and modified accordingly.
